fields.description: We would like the general user bulk creation of issues from CSV to support a specified issue key so that links are easily imported along with the other data.  This feature appears to be only supported by the Admin level CSV import, but this means we are forced to route new project imports to an admin user, or give admin permissions to more users.
fields.summary: Bulk Create Issues from CSV with Issue Key Specified

fields.description:
When using the "days" format for time tracking there are several mismatches in the way we display the tracked time.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Days
Majority of the date formats are shown using *t* (for tage).

However, when for example using the log work functionality, the *t* is not an accepted input for days as it's still expecting the english date notation *d* for inserts. 

So the time is displayed with suffix *t* but has to be inserted with suffix *d*.

See screenshot below with example:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Hours
The tracked time still shows *H* for hours instead of *S* for stunde.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

This is causing a lot of confusion when trying to input time.
fields.summary: German Language Pack - t which is short for tage (days) is not supported for input to define days.

fields.description:
Hi,

currently I have a big issue to face.

We have a lot of old projects and users. Some of them which already left the company or aren't involved in the project anymore. I disable them and then leave them alone until a year has passed. We aren't a big company but with 30 users in the user management it already starts to look messy. This is one of the reason why I'd want to deleted users rather than just disable them.

Now with the new European privacy regulation (DSGVO) we even have to delete all personal data of a user, too.

What I do now: I take the user, delete the profile picture and set their name to dummy values. This may be a legitimate way in privacy matters. But now I have a few disabled users with generic names. If this list keeps growing, I'm going to have a problem.

Now I just can't delete the users. I wouldn't have a problem with that, but Jira just doesn't let me, because the users have issues where they are assigned or reporters. Even though the projects are already concluded. That alone wouldn't be a problem, since I have a system user which I could bulk change all the issues to. The issue here are comments. It's not easy to get a list of all issues with comments of this user and it's even harder to delete these comments. And it's nearly impossible to change the author of a comment.

As I said, I'm obligated to remove all personal data of a user. And a lot of other companies, especially in Europe, will have to deal with this, too.

So why not just give the option to delete a user, even though he has comments and is assigned or reporter of an issue? You could just remove the user then, and assign the ticket to Unassigned or a specified/default user. And the comments: Just replace the name with a placeholder like "Deleted User" and remove the link to the profile. This way all the history is kept and it's not linked to a specific person.
fields.summary: Deleting users and anonymize their data in issues and comments
Include image size hints in wiki markup documentation

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Currently, according to our KB in [Tabs Don't Show up on View Issue Screen in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/tabs-don-t-show-up-on-view-issue-screen-in-jira-873947916.html], it states that the following conditions must be met for a custom field to be displayed on a secondary tab:
{panel}
# All of the tabs have custom fields on them (including the default Field Tab).
# At least one of those custom field types must not be a Date or People type (as those will show up in their respective sections in the view issue screen).
# At least one of those custom fields must have a value.
{panel}
The condition for all tabs to have at least one custom field in order for the custom field to show correctly on the tab may not fit into an organization's business case.

h2. Suggestion
Ensure that the custom fields can appear on secondary tabs even when condition #1 or #2 are not met.
fields.summary: Show custom fields on secondary tabs in issue view screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Caches in Jira Data Center are synchronous and have no guaranteed delivery. Synchronous replication may cause problems with scalability, as each change in cache needs to be replicated to other nodes. It means each change is blocking other actions for the caller until completed. Second important thing is that replication event is not guaranteed to be delivered. If something goes wrong, there is an exception when replicating - the operation will not be redone and cluster may be inconsistent, until cache will be refreshed. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Caches in Data Center should be replicated asynchronously (async) using persistent layer as a separation of HTTP thread and RMI replication mechanism.
 * HTTP thread will be responsible only for persisting replication events to queues and replication itself should happen asynchronously to that thread.
 * The order of replication events coming from one HTTP request should be preserved.
 * Replication event is removed from queue only when there is confirmation of successful replication to other node.
 * If replication can not be done, replication event will remain in queue, waiting for possibility to replicate
fields.summary: Asynchronous cache replication in Jira Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA version 4.2.4 there is an "Assign To Me" button in the issue details screen which allows the user to change the issue's assignee value without going through one of the user-defined workflow steps. This defeats the purpose of having configurable workflows steps since the user is able to change the state of the issue outside of the workflow. There should be a way to configure JIRA so that this button can be hidden or disabled.

An admin should also have the ability to hide the Assign menu button on the top of a ticket for the same purposes as listed above. If a user wants to only have the assignee determined by a workflow, this hinders that ability.

*Workaround*
There is no workaround actually.
fields.summary: Provide ability to hide or disable "Assign to me" button for specific projects

fields.description:
Summary
 When attempting to click on the "Link Bitbucket Cloud or Github" button at <jira-url>/secure/admin/ConfigureDvcsOrganizations!default.jspa, nothing happens.

There seems to be a syntax error in the JS console (see attached). This error does not appear on other pages.

There is nothing in the logs that seems related.

Environment 
 Jira Server - Bitbucket Cloud
 Jira 7.8.1 - 7.9.0
 Steps to Reproduce
 Click on the "Link Bitbucket Cloud or Github" button at <jira-url>/secure/admin/ConfigureDvcsOrganizations!default.jspa
h3. Workaround 

1. Stop JIRA
2. Remove the JIRA_HOME/plugin/installed-plugins/jira-dvcs-connector-plugin-4.3.0.jar file
3. Download and move [^jira-dvcs-connector-plugin-4.2.1.jar] into that directory
4. Start JIRA
fields.summary: "Link Bitbucket Cloud or Github" does not work

fields.description:
h3. *+Summary+*
Image are not downloaded from the clicking of download button in Attachment Image Preview using IE web-browser. 

h3. *Environment*
Internet Explorer 11.0.9600.18860

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Attach an image to an issue.
# Click on the image and then click the download button on the preview.
# Image will be opened in new a tab instead of downloading the image. 

h3. *Expected Results*
Clicking download icon in Attachment Image Preview will download the image.

h3. *Actual Results*
Clicking download icon in Attachment Image Preview open the image in a new tab rather than downloading it

h3. *Workaround*
Right-click the image and choose "*Save picture as*" to download.
fields.summary: In IE, clicking download icon in Attachment Image Preview open the image in a new tab rather than downloading it

fields.description:
As a Programme Manager I am interested in reporting on and taking action on those issues that are blocking progress across the various work-streams that I run.

I have mandated across the programme that as soon as sprint items are blocked that a corresponding blocking issue is created and the "blocked by" field is updated on all impacted tasks.

I was looking for a report that can be provided to me on a daily basis that provides a summary "aged blockers" with the list of blocked tasks. This will both allow me to ensure my PM's are on the case as well as giving me advanced visibility of problem areas or high impact issues.

I have had one of my developers try to put together a jscript filter for this but although it seems possible to see the impactedby field in drop downs it is not possible to produce a summary report, or any kind of "Blockers" management dashboard.

I am told that there are 3rd party plug-ins that may provide this, but am not in a position to authorise the upgrade to a corporate Jira web instance.

I would be grateful therefore if someone can advise on this as it seems (to me) to be a fundamental requirement.
fields.summary: Blocks or Blocked by Report
REST API returns 400 error with misleading message when editing issues

fields.description:
Users receive error "To update this sprint you must have Project Administrator permissions for all of the following projects: Project X" when they were not able to close sprint.

The error message only mentioned that use needs to have Project Administrator permission for specific projects but does not mention the specific tickets causing this nor why a user might need permissions to all projects because of a complex board filter in use. 

Suggest to display explicit error messages when user is not able to close sprints.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator unable to close a sprint I would like to know what specific issues from projects I don't have administer project permissions
Duplicate value in "Time in Status" Field persists despite fix code in place

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When pasting text into a code macro within the visual text editor, this does not preserve line breaks. However, when pasting straight into the comment, it does preserve line breaks. We would expect the code macro to behave the same, especially in the case of code blocks where line breaks are important and need to be kept.

Video of Issue: [Code Macro - Line Breaks|https://screencast.com/t/AleCEyKFAQp]

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Copy text from a document (or use a terminal command with multi line output; such as {{dig @8.8.8.8 google.com MX}}
# Using the Visual Mode in Jira, insert a "Code Block" or "Preformatted" macro
# Paste into the macro

h3.Expected Results
The text is pasted with line breaks intact.

h3.Actual Results
The text is not pasted with line breaks intact.

h3.Workaround
Using the {{\{code\}}} or {{\{noformat\}}} macros in "Text" mode will preserve the line breaks.
fields.summary: Visual Text Editor: Code macro does not preserve line breaks from pasted text

fields.description:
h5. Summary
External gadgets have a hard-coded timeout of 60s to load content. If there is a large volume of data to be loaded, it will silently timeout and fail.

h5. Suggestion
Allow the value for timeout to be setup by a Jira administrator, either via user interface or via a .properties file.
fields.summary: Allow timeout for loading external gadgets content to be configured

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Can't paste link from clipboard while inserting link via External link option in Visual mode, Wiki markup syntax for link gets replaced with initial link name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy some HTTP link in clipboard
 # Add new comment
 # In Visual mode, enter link name (eg. LINK) and select it, then click Link button and select External link:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 The following text appear after clicking the External link:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 # Select [http://example.com|http://example.com/] text with the cursor and paste the link from clipboard in order to replace example link.

h3. Expected Results

The link is pasted from the clipboard successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The link isn't pasted and wiki markup for link is removed, only the initial name of the link is displayed:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Before pasting the link from clipboard, delete [http://example.com|http://example.com/] text and paste the link (do not select it and paste over it).

h3. Notes
* Reproduced in Firefox and Chrome
fields.summary: Can't paste link from clipboard while inserting link via External link in Visual mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA by default can only use the JQL: *issuekey in issueHistory() ORDER BY lastViewed DESC* to view recently viewed issue by current users only. There is no method to get a list of recently viewed issues by particular users. This will be useful for team managers to track their team members last viewed tickets.

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend the JQL capability to be able to list down the recently viewed issues by other users

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Recently viewed issues for other users

Link containing issue key and / or filter appears as a normal text after changing the comment in Visual mode.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
 # Save the comment

h3. Expected Results

Changing the comment preserves the link
h3. Actual Results

After changing the comment, the link appears as plain text and link information is lost:
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

-
h3. Notes

fields.description:
On the [Creating issues and comments from email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-938847641.html], it is stated that the incoming processed mails are deleted from the mailbox, regardless if the mailbox type is POP / IMAP:
{quote}
Note — how JIRA handles messages on a mail server/service:

* For mail accounts, JIRA scans email messages received by your mail account's 'Inbox' folder. However, for IMAP mail servers, you can specify a different folder within your mail account.
* If JIRA successfully processes a message, JIRA deletes the message from your mail account (on a POP or IMAP mail server) or file system (i.e. for file system messages).
* If JIRA does not successfully process a message, the message will remain either in your mail account or on the file system.
{quote}

*This should be corrected as messages are deleted only from the POP mailboxes, while on IMAP mailboxes, these are just marked as read.*
fields.summary: Creating issues and comments from email - documentation correction regarding deleting mail

fields.description: The changes to the UIX are not an improvement and have caused issues with confusion in my user community.
fields.summary: the current new UIX is not an improvement

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a direct HTML link to create issues in a Jira Software project, users will encounter an NPE when the {{issuetype}} parameter is omitted. In addition, the issue type field will be blank and non-selectable. See attached PDF illustrating the issue. 

The issue appears to be due to validator that ensures that issues aren't being created as child Epics of existing Epics.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In a Jira Software project, use the following URL to create an issue:

{{BASE_URL/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10001}}

(substituting a suitable project ID as needed)

h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to select the issue type during creation.

h3. Actual Results
Issue type is non-selectable and NPE is thrown, as illustrated in the attached PDF and abbreviated here:

{code:none}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isIssueOfTypeEpic' in class com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkCFType threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jir link/templates/greenhopper/jira/customfield/epiclink/edit­epiclink.vm[line 5, column 36]
{code}

h3.Workaround
Direct HTML links must be modified to include the {{issuetype}} parameter, e.g.:

{{BASE_URL/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10001&issuetype=10004}}
fields.summary: CreateIssueDetails.jspa should account for NULL issuetype when creating issues via direct HTML links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"America/Montreal" is set an alias to "America/Toronto" and causes the behavior described in:
- [Accessing JIRA Agile Board Configuration throws Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'regionKey' of undefined | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/accessing-jira-agile-board-configuration-throws-exception-uncaught-typeerror-cannot-read-property-regionkey-of-undefined-776829400.html]

This seems to affect more timezones ID, most "Alias" listed in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones is affected to the problem. https://time.is/ website is up-to-date on the latest timezone ID alias from IANA Timezone database.

h5. Possible cause
CentOS 6 allows the use of timezone code "America/Montreal" and recognized by Jira,  Upgrade to CentOS 7 and "America/Montreal" is proxied or alias to "America/Toronto"

h3. Environment
* Verified with JIra7.7.1 and CentOS 6.4 upgraded to CentOS 7.4
* Possibly also affects other OS See:
** https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tzdata/+bug/1245978
** https://bitbucket.org/pellepim/jstimezonedetect/issues/153/use-only-timezones-specified-by-php

h3. Expected Results
- Jira correctly recognizes ported Timecode from Montreal to Toronto
- Jira correctly recognize all timezone ID alias

h3. Actual Results
"America/Montreal"  does not update and stays as the deprecated value, so  Loading Board with an owner still tied to "America/Montreal" Triggers
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'regionKey' of undefined
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Either:
* Have owner of Board Navigate to user preferences and change timezone to 'America/Toronto'
* Follow Workaround in:
** [Accessing JIRA Agile Board Configuration throws Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'regionKey' of undefined | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/accessing-jira-agile-board-configuration-throws-exception-uncaught-typeerror-cannot-read-property-regionkey-of-undefined-776829400.html]
fields.summary: CentOS Upgrade Breaks Time Settings for America/Montreal and other Timezone ID alias

fields.description:
When using Visual mode in the text editor, typing
{noformat}
{quote} {noformat}
should render the quote box for you to begin typing such as noformat, but does not. Wrapping the text in quote markdown does not work either, as the system is adding in an escape character before the secondary quote markdown. 

Video of issue: [Screencast|https://screencast.com/t/0FzGgtPjE8]

*Steps to Reproduce:*

 # Within comment box, type "\{quote}"
 # Observe it does not render the quote block

 # Click Add, and observe broken text

fields.summary: Visual Mode Text Editor does not render quote-block - adds escape character breaking format

fields.description:
Jira Service Desk does not provide customer notification on "Issue Updated Events"

Possible fix: Change the event triggered when an attachment is sent via email to be "Issue Commented" rather than "Issue Updated" or generate two events. It seems like all comments should generate "Issue Commented" events.
fields.summary: Trigger more than one event, we suggest triggering both “Issue commented” and “Issue updated” when an issue is updated with comments and attachments.

fields.description:
h5. Description
Keep the scrolling position on a Jira issue when using the browser Back button.

h5. Steps To Reproduce:
# Go to Jira issue.
# Scroll down until you find a link to another page.
# Click on it.
# Click on browser back button.
# Notice that the issue is loaded back to the top of the page.
(i) This can be reproduced on clear Jira instances

h5. Expected Results
Resume my original position in the Jira issue view.

h5. Actual Results
My position in the Jira issue is gone and I have to re-scroll again to reach

fields.description:
_I'm sure I'm not the first to complain about this, but I couldn't find a similar discussion in the existing issues. (If anyone can point me to one, I'd be happy to upvote it and delete this one)_

Adding links in nearly all other online products (e.g., Google, StackOverflow, MSOffice, etc) is as simple as selecting a word, typing Ctrl+K, pasting a URL from the clipboard.Enter. Done.

But in Jira this common task is so much more cumbersome. I have to select the word (which is hard enough because the standard double-click actually selects the word _and_ the space after it), then Ctrl+K, at which point my selected word gets replaced with a square-bracketed markup. Then I have to carefully select the "http://example.com" snippet (again, difficult because I can't just double-click on it, as I could if it just said URL_Here or something), then I can paste my URL.

BUT, worst of all is that none of this works in Visual mode. If I forget to switch to Text mode first, the whole thing gets garbled.

In Chrome, at least I can type the link markup manually (in Visual mode), but that doesn't work in IE (when I type the final square bracket in IE/Visual mode, the entire tag disappears!)

This is such a common task, I wish Jira could make it "just work" on the standard browsers.
fields.summary: Adding URL links should be easier

fields.description:
When within a comment box, you can drag and drop an attachment over to it in order to attach to the case. The issue here being the system seems to display two different behaviors. One where the attachments is added to the case and not the comment, and one where the attachment is added to the case and comment. You can see which behavior will occur based on the orange outline not appearing when hovering the attachments over the comment box, and the tooltip reads "move".

*Video of issue:* [ScreenCast|https://screencast.com/t/kNWuja7IrGuF]

*Steps to Repro:*

+*See video*+ +*for how to replicate based on click and drag movements*+
 # Create new issue
 # Select comment box
 # Click and drag an attachment into the comment box
 ## Observe if the orange border appears
 ### If not, the attachment will be added to the comment and case
 ### If it does, the attachment will be added to the case only
fields.summary: Jira sometimes allows drag and drop attachment to comment box, and other times attaches file to case instead.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
When trying to create a branch through JIRA Development Panel, a pop-up with a 'null.prompt' will be showing instead of getting redirected to Bitbucket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Have JIRA integrated with Bitbucket Server.
# Access JIRA using Firefox.
# Navigate to any of JIRA Tickets.
# In the Development Panel click "Create Branch"

h3. Expected Behavior:
The user will be redirected to Bitbucket to create a branch.

h3. Actual Behavior:
A 'null.prompt' pop-up will appear instead.

h3. Notes:
* At the moment when I replicate the issue, so far it is only possible through Firefox using my Machine.
* Tested with JIRA 7.8.0 and Bitbucket Server 5.8.0
* With JAC is running on 7.8.0, the issue itself could be replicable here:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* From my observation, when the feature works, the issue would not happen anymore until I clear my browser cache.
fields.summary: "null.prompt" pop-up when creating branch from JIRA.

fields.description:
It would be nice if JIRA had a database latency check similar to what Confluence has in the *System Information* page, which performs the following test to return a value:

{quote}
The latency is calculated by sending a trivial request to the database, querying a table which is known to have only one column and one row.  ("select * from CLUSTERSAFETY"). Obviously this query should be blazing fast, and return within 1 or 2 milliseconds. 
{quote}

From https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/performance-tuning-130289.html

h3. Note on the implementation

The latency measurement is added to the support zip. It's available in application-properties/application.xml under <Database-latency-measurement-milliseconds> element.
fields.summary: Add Database Latency Check to JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the document [Managing users - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-users-938847015.html] we refer to the abilities of administrators in Jira:
{quote}
As an administrator, you can manage users directly in JIRA, or enable public signup so users can create their own accounts.  
{quote}

However Jira Project Administrators do *not* have this ability.  You need to be either a Jira Administrator OR a Jira system administrator to manage this aspect.

h3. Problem
This can be confusing for individuals trying to manager user access within Jira. 


h3. Suggested solution
We should be more explicit as to the exact global permission level needed to effect change here.   In addition to re-wording this, it might help to add a header like that we see on the [Managing global permissions - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/managing-global-permissions-861253290.html].

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Method com.atlassian.jira.index.summary.DefaultIndexSummarizer#getCountOfIssuesInIndex forces {{issueSearcher}} to be closed each execution.  If {{IndexSearcher.close()}} is called it might result in closing the underneath reader and causing JVM crash with SIGSEGV under heavy load.

h3. Expected Results
Method getCountOfIssuesInIndex() will not close {{issueSearcher}} 

h3. Actual Results
Method getCountOfIssuesInIndex() closes {{issueSearcher}} 
You may see the following exception:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$AlreadyClosedException: java.io.IOException
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper.close(DelayCloseable.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearcher(SearcherCache.java:79)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearchers(SearcherCache.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.flushThreadLocalSearchers(DefaultIndexManager.java:1020)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.searchers.ThreadLocalSearcherCache.resetSearchers(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:31)
        ... 20 filtered
        at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
        ... 26 filtered
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: java.io.IOException
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$AlreadyClosedException.<init>(DelayCloseable.java:37)
        ... 57 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Under heavy load on Jira and execution of {{getCountOfIssuesInIndex()}} may close index that is still being read by another thread and as a result cause  SIGSEGV like this:
{noformat}
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f66338faaea, pid=66449, tid=0x00007f4dd99f1700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_151-b12) (build 1.8.0_151-b12)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.151-b12 mixed mode linux-amd64 )
# Problematic frame:
# J 8554 C2 org.apache.lucene.store.MMapDirectory$MMapIndexInput.readByte()B (81 bytes) @ 0x00007f66338faaea [0x00007f66338faaa0+0x4a]
{noformat}
** More information why this is happening can be found here [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-6943?focusedCommentId=15070960&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15070960] 
* Another example of SIGSEGV: 
{noformat}
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007fb0f16fa390, pid=63009, tid=0x00007f9fb94d2700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_152-b16) (build 1.8.0_152-b16)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.152-b16 mixed mode linux-amd64 )
# Problematic frame:
# v  ~StubRoutines::jbyte_disjoint_arraycopy

Stack: [0x00007fc9d9dc6000,0x00007fc9d9ec7000],  sp=0x00007fc9d9ebfff0,  free space=999k
Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)
v  ~StubRoutines::jbyte_disjoint_arraycopy
J 109528 C2 org.apache.lucene.index.CompoundFileReader$CSIndexInput.readInternal([BII)V (55 bytes) @ 0x00007fdc036f1882 [0x00007fdc036f14a0+0x3e2]
J 23635 C2 org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readByte()B (32 bytes) @ 0x00007fdbfb5b24b4 [0x00007fdbfb5b2400+0xb4]
J 31429 C2 org.apache.lucene.store.DataInput.readVInt()I (132 bytes) @ 0x00007fdbff486510 [0x00007fdbff4864e0+0x30]
{noformat}
** example at Oracle tracker: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8179671 

h3.Workaround
None

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user was created with a trailing (or leading) non-breaking space on its username, this string will be used as the *user_key* for the user, even if the username is changed. This results in an error when trying to add this user to a project role, where the following error message will be presented: {{We can't find 'USERNAME' in any accessible user directory. Check they're still active and available, and try again.}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user using a trailing non-breaking space character (U+00A0).
# Attempt to add the user to a project role.

h3. Expected Results
The user is added to the selected role.

h3. Actual Results
The action to add the user to a role in the project fails with the following error message on the UI: {{We can't find 'USERNAME' in any accessible user directory. Check they're still active and available, and try again.}}
No errors show up in the application logs about this.

h3. Notes
This issue happens on all browsers.

h3. Workaround
*Note that we strongly advise against manually changing the user's USER_KEY through the database, as this can result in multiple inconsistencies on references made to this user in the database.*

At this time, the only known workaround is to capture the failed request using the browser's developer tools, correct the *user_key* on the request and then running this request through a cURL command.

The instructions below are tailored to Google Chrome, but you should be able to capture this data with any browser.

# Navigate to the *Users and roles* page in a Project.
# Open the *Network* tab inside *Developer Tools*.
# Attempt to add the user to a role.
# Once it fails, you will notice a bad request (400).
# Right click on the failed request and select the *Copy as cURL* option.
# At the end on the request, you will find a JSON array listing the users that are supposed to be added to the role:
{code}
'{"users":["USERNAME"],"groups":[]}'
{code}
# Without changing any other information on the request, add the non-breaking space to the username inside the array:
{code}
'{"users":["USERNAME "],"groups":[]}'
{code}
# Run the request through the terminal. If the user is successfully added, the output of the cURL command will be as follows:
{code}
{"numberOfGroupsAdded":0,"numberOfUsersAdded":1}
{code}
fields.summary: Trailing non-breaking space in user's USER_KEY causes error when adding user to a project role

h3. Summary

JIRA 7.8 apache-httpclient 4.5.4, which is affected by [HTTPCLIENT-1888|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1888]. This has been fixed in 4.5.5 and it is released and available.
h3. Environment

This will only affect instances that use an outbound proxy.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira with an outbound proxy with authentication.
 # There are multiple ways to repro - accessing the dashboard or the support tools section are the easiest.

h3. Expected Results

Gadgets display and the end of life healthcheck does not fail.
h3. Actual Results

The below stack trace is present and the client cannot establish a connection as the exception is thrown.
{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException

fields.description: By default any column right next to "kanban backlog" in column management in Kanban board will also show right above "backlog" in Kanban board backlog view. It was designed to make it easy for end user to move issues from the backlog to the column above, for example "in progress". This caused confusing to end users and not necessary for end user has other workflow/method to move the case from "backlog" to "in progress". End user should have an option to only view backlogs in backlog view.

fields.description:
On occasion, we build or utilize tools that integrate with JIRA. In many cases, the best way to centralize knowledge or convey updates from engineering tools is to automatically comment on or update the relevant Jira issue.

However, not all updates are relevant to all individuals on a ticket. For instance, a UX designer may not want to be notified when there is a Java compilation error in the build system, but may need to watch the ticket for other relevant comments or updates. This results in Jira sending many emails that are categorically irrelevant to some users. The only option to mute irrelevant notifications is to create a custom filter in the mail system (gmail, outlook, etc) based on the content of the notification.

*As a Jira user, I would like to define a list of Jira usernames for whose actions I would prefer not to receive an email update*. Similarly, I would like to provide organization-wide instructions to mute certain user actions for users who are annoyed by the "spam" they receive from automated users.
fields.summary: Disable or mute notifications by actor username

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Importing a CSV with different parent id specified could result in association with multiple parents.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue.
# Create a new project.
# Create two tasks, called it Parent 1 and Parent 2 respectively.
# Create two sub-tasks for Parent 1.
# In the issue navigator, search for all issues in the new project.
# Add _Sub-Tasks_ as one of the columns and remove other columns.
 !search.png|thumbnail! 
# Export the result as CSV with *current fields*.
# The CSV file will look like the following.
{code}
Issue Type,Issue key,Issue id,Parent id,Summary,Assignee,Reporter
Sub-task,CSVI-4,10103,10100,Sub-task 2,,admin
Sub-task,CSVI-3,10102,10100,Sub-task 1,,admin
Task,CSVI-2,10101,,Parent 2,,admin
Task,CSVI-1,10100,,Parent 1,,admin
{code}
# Edit the CSV file to change the parent id of Sub-task 2 from Parent 1 to Parent 2.
{code}
Issue Type,Issue key,Issue id,Parent id,Summary,Assignee,Reporter
Sub-task,CSVI-4,10103,10101,Sub-task 2,,admin
Sub-task,CSVI-3,10102,10100,Sub-task 1,,admin
Task,CSVI-2,10101,,Parent 2,,admin
Task,CSVI-1,10100,,Parent 1,,admin
{code}
# Import the CSV file via {{Administration > System > External System Import > CSV}}.
# Map the values only for issue ID, issue type, issue key and summary.

h3. Expected result
Sub-task 2 will be a sub-task of Parent 2 and only Parent 2.

h3. Actual result
Sub-task 2 will be a sub-task of both Parent 1 and Parent 2. 
 !multiple-parent.png|thumbnail! 
It's also associated to 2 parent tasks in the database.
{code:SQL}
select i.id as "child_id", ( p.pkey || '-' || i.issuenum ) as "child_key", it.pname as "child_type", it.pstyle as "child_type_style", t.count as "number_of_parents", parent_i.id as "parent_id", ( parent_p.pkey || '-' || parent_i.issuenum ) as "parent_key", parent_it.pname as "parent_type" from jiraissue i join project p on i.project = p.id join issuetype it on i.issuetype = it.id join (select destination, count(*) from issuelink where linktype= (select id from issuelinktype where linkname = 'jira_subtask_link') group by destination having count(*) > 1) t on i.id = t.destination join issuelink parent_l on i.id = parent_l.destination join jiraissue parent_i on parent_l.source = parent_i.id join project parent_p on parent_p.id = parent_i.project join issuetype parent_it on parent_i.issuetype = parent_it.id where parent_l.linktype in (select id from issuelinktype where linkname = 'jira_subtask_link') order by child_id desc;
{code} 
Here's the result from the database.
||child_id||child_key||child_type||child_type_style||number_of_parents||parent_id||parent_key||parent_type||
|10103|CSVI-4|Sub-task|jira_subtask|2|10101|CSVI-2|Task||
|10103|CSVI-4|Sub-task|jira_subtask|2|10100|CSVI-1|Task||

h3. Workaround
Use the _Move Issue_ operation to change the parent to Parent 2. That way, the association with Parent 1 will be dismissed.
fields.summary: Importing same sub-task from CSV with diferrent parent id would cause the sub-task to linked with multiple parents

Currently Jira requires the ability to modify its database schema by adding and altering tables as part of plugin installs/upgrades ( Active Objects ) and product upgrades

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This appears to be a regression of:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-16755
h3. {color:#333333}Removing the browse project permission removes the ability for a customer to edit a dashboard that is shared to that project. Resulting in an "unknown project" in the shares of the project. {color}

{color:#333333}!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!{color}
h3. {color:#333333}Steps to reproduce{color}
 * create a new dashboard
 * share it to a project
 * remove the browse project permission for that user
 * user can no longer edit or add gadgets to the dashboard

  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected behavior

The user should be able to edit and add gadgets as the board's permission shouldn't be usurped by the project regardless of where it is shared, it should abandon the share from the dashboard. 
h3. Workaround

Users can still edit the dashboard, so deleting the share to the unknown project will restore functionality, see video attached for more information. 

 

[^dashoboardissuepermissions.mov]
fields.summary: Removing the browse project role removes the ability for a customer to edit gadgets in a dashboard that is shared to that project

fields.description:
h4. Problem

On large instance (ie. 5000+ projects), deleting applink can cause system slowness. 
h4. *Steps* to reproduce
 # Jira with 5000+ projects 
 # Create a dummy applink 
 # Delete the applink

h4. Result

Jira triggers 5000+ database calls just to remove the applink properties, subsequently halting other operations until the applink is removed. In this case, can take about 5-10minutes.

!image-2018-03-14-16-41-49-280.png|width=268,height=118!
h4. Diagnostic

In *atlassian-jira-sql.log* you can see the following line */rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/<applink-id>* iterating through all *jira_project.linked.entities*, which can be large in Enterprise.
{code:java}
2018-03-12 04:52:31,780 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService] Deleting application link id [09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad]
2018-03-12 04:52:31,780 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService$DefaultEntityLinkService] Deleting Entity Links for Application Link [09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad]
2018-03-12 04:52:31,832 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService$DefaultEntityLinkService] Setting stored entity links for [DEVOPS] [jira.project] as [[]]
2018-03-12 04:52:31,833 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.a.core.property.SalPropertySet] Putting property [linked.entities] as namespace [applinks.local.DEVOPS.jira_project.linked.entities] with value [[]]
2018-03-12 04:52:31,833 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.a.core.property.HashingLongPropertyKeysPluginSettings] Putting key [applinks.local.DEVOPS.jira_project.linked.entities] as hashKey [applinks.local.DEVOPS.jira_project.linked.entities] with value [[]]
2018-03-12 04:52:31,951 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService$DefaultEntityLinkService] Setting stored entity links for [DQIM] [jira.project] as [[]]
2018-03-12 04:52:31,952 http-nio-8080-exec-1 DEBUG 1572322 292x422x1 togqcz 192.168.32.8 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/09fd3e1f-a6a1-359f-9dc9-2efd88b1f5ad [c.a.a.core.property.SalPropertySet] Putting property [linked.entities] as namespace [applinks.local.DQIM.jira_project.linked.entities] with value [[]]
{code}
h4. Root cause. 

When deleting applink, the following happen
 # _com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService#deleteApplicationLink_ gets called
 # It calls _com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService#deleteEntityLinksFor_
 # This method performs operations on the linked entities one-by-one in a loop (at least one linked entity exists for every project on the instance)
 # Indirectly, some locks are being held during the operations, (e.g. by accessing some collections shared with other threads)
 # Each iteration performs a query to the database (while holding the lock)
 # Our client has over 5000 properties and each query, according to the logs, takes more than 50ms to complete. This, coupled with the locking slows entire Jira instance down.

The loop inside deleteEntityLinksFor should be optimized to perform the deletes in bulk with only one query, as the 5000 roundtrips to the database are the bottleneck here. 
h4. Workaround. 

None. Avoid deleting Applink during peak hour. 
h4. Timeout error and Config error when creating an application link
 * Since it takes some time to delete the application link, even if the UI indicated the application link is deleted, Jira's log is still deleting the entity links in the background.
{noformat}
2019-04-19 14:48:31,802 http-nio-8192-exec-22 DEBUG sasa 886x797x1 1ni6qxl 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/a0e7c7c2-8633-3002-8379-538907da08a0 [c.a.applinks.core.DefaultApplicationLinkService$DefaultEntityLinkService] Setting stored entity links for [YENE] [jira.project] as [[]]
2019-04-19 14:48:31,802 http-nio-8192-exec-22 DEBUG sasa 886x797x1 1ni6qxl 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks/a0e7c7c2-8633-3002-8379-538907da08a0 [c.a.a.core.property.SalPropertySet] Putting property [linked.entities] as namespace [applinks.local.YENE.jira_project.linked.entities] with value [[]]
{noformat}

 * If a new application link is created during this time, timeout error and config error will be returned in the UI.

h4. Workaround
 * Suggest waiting until the deletion completely finished before creating a new application link.
 * From our testing, we suggest waiting for 10 minutes at least for Jira instance with 3000 projects.
fields.summary: Removing and creating applink can impact performance for instance with thousands of projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to embed attachment from [rich text editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/rich-text-editing-938847886.html] in case the attachment is hosted on the same domain.
 The situation is a bit complicated so please see the steps to reproduce below.
h3. Environment
 * Jira instance which is hosted in a domain {{example.com}} (The base URL is like [http://example.com/jira])
 * Some image files which are hosted in the same domain. The image URLs are like
 ## URL without context path like [http://example.com/image.png]
 ## URL with context path like [http://example.com/wiki/.../image.png] (Generally, this type of URL can be seen in Confluence which is hosted in the same domain of Jira)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start to edit comment
 # Change the edit mode to *Text* mode
 # Embed images which are listed in "Environment" section with following [the text formatting notation|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=attachments]
{code:java}
!http://example.com/image.png!
{code}
or
{code:java}
!http://example.com/wiki/.../image.png!
{code}

 # Save the comment
 # Now, you can see the image is embedded in the comment as expected
 # Start to edit the comment again
 # Change the edit mode to *Visual* mode
 # Add some texts after the embedded image
 # Save the comment

h3. Expected Results

The embedded image should be shown in the comment as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The embedded image was not shown and {{noimage}} thumbnail is shown instead.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

Also, if you open the editor in *Text* mode again, you can see the URL was replaced with the relative path.
{code:java}
!/image.png!
{code}
{code:java}
!/wiki/.../image.png!
{code}
h3. Note

Jira seems to expect that the attachment is located on [http://example.com/jira/image.png] ([http://<JIRA_BASE_URL>/image.png|http://%3Cjira_base_url%3E/image.png]) but is actually located on [http://example.com/image.png].
h3. Workaround

Editing comments in Text mode is the only workaround.
fields.summary: Unable to embed attachment from rich text editor in case the attachment is hosted on the same domain

fields.description:
Currently we already provide quite a few read-only permissions that give some users access to certain parts of the instance. However these functionalities are not intuitive and currently not designed (or sufficient) for Auditing teams.

Customer use-case is asking for these permissions specifically;
# View JIRA Project Roles.
# View JIRA Groups.
Currently available through ⚙ > System > Security > Global Permissions > Browse Users
# JIRA Groups and Roles assigned to Users.
Currently available through ⚙ > System > Security > Global Permissions > Browse Users
# View Workflows on JIRA Projects. 
Currently available through ⚙ Project Configuration > Permissions > View Read-Only Workflow
# View Audit Logs.
# View Permissions/Notification Schemes.
# View Global Permissions.
fields.summary: Create a Global permission for Auditing teams to have full read only access to the instance

fields.description:
h4. Summary:

When using advanced JQL query, if you need to search for an exact phrase and not a fuzzy search with the words in any order, you need to put the text in quotes using the escape character in them:
{noformat}
summary ~ "\"full screen\""
{noformat}
If you only use {{summary ~ "full screen"}}, Jira will find issues with texts both like "full screen" and "screen full".
----
The most recent documentation about JQL search doesn't show that this is possible. I was only able to find this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-CONTAINS%3A~] which contains the following about this behavior:

??Find all issues where the Summary contains the exact phrase "full screen" (see Reserved Characters for details on how to escape quote-marks and other special characters): summary ~ "\"full screen\""??

This information is only present in the Jira documentation up to version 6.4.

h4. Request:

The request is to add this information to the new documentation about JQL search.
fields.summary: Update the Advanced searching(JQL) documentation to include the literal\exact search option.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if JIRA is using LDAP like Active Directory, the password is set to expire in certain days and the password does expire, the user will not be able to login unless the password is reset.

Some JIRA Administrators would like JIRA to authenticate user in Internal Directory if authentication from LDAP fails.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option in JIRA to allow user to be authenticated from Internal Directory if authentication from LDAP fails. 


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to authenticate user from Internal Directory if authentication from LDAP fails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently if the usernameA already exist in JIRA and there is already data association with it but this user has already left the company however if there is a new user in the feature using the same usernameA being sync into JIRA, it will reuse back all the association and group membership belongs to the old user.
h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Static files served via Tomcat are inefficient. As a result, users experience a delay in loading pages that retrieve these files. 

h3. Environment
Jira Server regardless private or public facing

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Chrome, run the Developer Tools and select the Network tab
 # Access Jira via an invalid link. For example: <baseURL>/random
 # Monitor the time taken to load the 404 page

h3. Expected Results
Error 404 Page Not Found should be returned immediately

h3. Actual Results
It takes about 20s+ to load the page and most of it are spent on retrieving {{/static-assets/metal-all.css}} and {{/static-assets/metal-all.js}}

h3. Notes
This behaviour does not affect Jira integrated with Nginx


{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This was originally raised in [Jira tinkerers beware: Tomcat does not serve raw files correctly, causing browser hangs|https://www.redradishtech.com/display/KB/Jira+tinkerers+beware%3A+Tomcat+does+not+serve+raw+files+correctly%2C+causing+browser+hangs]
{panel}
fields.summary: Ineffective static files served through Tomcat

fields.description:
We have a tool which can connect to Jira to update case fields. After we upgrade from 7.2 to 7.5.3, the connection report error, you can check attachment.

We found JIRA 7.3 upgrade SSL part as noted [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-3-x-upgrade-notes-861251109.html]

we found the cause and possible solution [https://confluence.atlassian.com/stashkb/could-not-generate-dh-keypair-on-ssl-715129360.html]

 

For the solution mentioned, the first workaround as below

Add DH parameter limits to the target server's certificate. First, generate custom DH parameters by using openssl dhparam command and apply it with the [SSLCertificateFile|http://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/mod_ssl.html#sslcertificatefile] directive. The custom DH parameters with a 1024-bit prime will always have precedence over any of the built-in DH parameters. 

 

We have tried on client side, execute the command 'openssl dhparam 1024', then upload the output to Jira server. But our server SSL configuration use keystore format as below

keystoreFile="/opt/atlassian/jira/jre/bin/jira2.jks"

And the keystore file has 3 certificate files, which one we need to add?

root.crt

commany.crt

jiraweburl.crt

We have put DH part to the end of file 'jiraweburl.crt', it still report the same error.

 

Could you help guide us how to resolve the issue quickly?

Thanks
fields.summary: Connect to JIRA report 'Could not generate DH keypair'

No workaround at this point of time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
# Currently, to create a Project from REST API, we will need to provide projectTemplateKey as per the example from [JIRA 7.7.1 Create Project REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.7.1/#api/2/project-createProject]:
{noformat}
{
    "key": "EX",
    "name": "Example",
    "projectTypeKey": "business",
    "projectTemplateKey": "com.atlassian.jira-core-project-templates:jira-core-project-management",
    "description": "Example Project description",
    "lead": "Charlie",
    "url": "http://atlassian.com",
    "assigneeType": "PROJECT_LEAD",
    "avatarId": 10200,
    "issueSecurityScheme": 10001,
    "permissionScheme": 10011,
    "notificationScheme": 10021,
    "categoryId": 10120
}
{noformat}
# However, there is no REST API endpoint to retrieve the available {{projectTemplateKey}} from JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a REST API endpoint for us to retrieve the available {{projectTemplateKey}} from JIRA so that we can use the {{projectTemplateKey}} during the Project creation.
 
h3. Workaround 
The available {{projectTemplateKey}} is listed in [JIRA API 7.1.0 Create Project - Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/JIRA-API-7-1-0-Create-Project/qaq-p/551444].
fields.summary: Provide REST API endpoint to retrieve projectTemplateKey

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
JIRA users are able to bulk move issues. When performing this operation the issues will be presented to the user so that they may select the destination.
 * This selection occurs at "Step 3 of 4: Select Projects and Issue Types"

This page will combine issues into groups, allowing a destination to be selected for that group.

+Example+:
 * "You have chosen to move 1000 issues from 8 project(s) with 14 issue type(s). You can either select a new project and issue type for each of the existing 26 combinations below or choose to move all standard issues to a single project and issue type."

Each combination provides a project and issue type dropdown. In addition sub-tasks also show a third dropdown for selecting a new parent.
 * Note: JIRA does not combine sub-tasks into a combination on the bulk move page when those sub-tasks have different parents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Use very large instance, greater than 2000 projects and issue types
 * Ensure user performing action has permission for these projects
 * Attempt bulk move where the set of issues contains a large number of subtasks that have distinct parents
 ** Example JQL: "issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes()"

h3. Problem Behavior:
Instances with a large number of projects and issue types may encounter memory issues if a large number of combinations appear. This can result in OutOfMemoryError when rendering the page.

h3. Expected Behavior: 
JIRA prevents the page from causing memory issues.
 * Perhaps a limit on the number of combinations that can be displayed
 * Or perhaps the page could be changed to work differently.

h3. Additional Details:
The presence of sub-tasks in the search results can result in a large number of combinations. JIRA does not combine sub-tasks into a combination on the bulk move page when those sub-tasks have different parents.

In one example we found 277 issues returned by the search. Mostly sub-tasks, these resulted in 271 combinations on the bulk move page.
 * Each of the 271 combinations loaded the following lists:
 ** Project List = 2590 values, 665135 characters, 650KB
 ** Issue type List = 3382 values, 985747 characters, 963KB

The total for just these lists was over 400MB. The entire BodyContentImpl containing these lists was over 900MB in size.
 * Five BodyContentImpl objects exist, all related to the bulk move. Total retained heap is around 6GB for these five objects

The large objects show in the dominator tree:
 * !image-2018-03-08-19-07-57-609.png|thumbnail!

Heap is consumed by very large Char objects tied to the bulk move:
 * !image-2018-03-08-19-10-09-524.png|thumbnail!
 * !image-2018-03-08-19-20-29-319.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Workaround 
Only move one set of (target project, target issue type) issues at a time.
fields.summary: Bulk move page with many combinations can result in OutOfMemoryError in large instances

fields.description:
*Current State:*

In JIRA Data Center a node starts and detects a problem with its copy of the index. The node will request a copy of the index from another node.
* Another node will make a backup zip file of the index and place that file into the shared home. The node that needs the copy will then retrieve the copy and restore that copy.

This automatic process will happen if a node is a member of a JIRA Data Center cluster. The automatic process cannot be disabled.
You may not need to wait for index copy to finish, for example: _you want to run Full-reindex at this node_ when cluster don't have valid index.

*Suggested Change:*

Allow an admin to disable the automatic copy so that JIRA can be started without triggering the index backup on another node. 
* The admin will then manually initiate the index copy using the option on the index administration page.
fields.summary: Ability to disable automatic index copy from another node during startup
